author: {'steamid': '76561199281981914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 518, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1712451278}
review:
This game got me hooked so fast! It is not as difficult as hotline Miami and more complex than Intravenous (but perhaps not too stealthy).

The game feels difficult at first and did not tell you much about the mechanics, particularly about how to save game works. You will get used to it, and remember that the save is somewhat limited to maximize the replayability (and excitement!)

If you find the game is a bit difficult, don't give up and try use the mutators. The unlimited ammo and extra lives are quite useful. Don't feel reluctant to use them. The developer has provided these to help you enjoy what you already purchased.

author: {'steamid': '76561199053652414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 26, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1711620929}
review:
昔の二頭身ＲＰＧのキャラみたいなのを操作してアクションゲームするのが、チマチマしすぎで楽しくない。
セリフも海外の陽気なノリで、最初の操作方法のチュートリアルさえも無駄に回りくどく鬱陶しい。
合わないことだらけですぐやめた。

author: {'steamid': '76561199148521892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1988, 'playtime_at_review': 3346, 'last_played': 1712264706}
review: Brilliant. Just Brilliant. It's very fun, and allows you to tackle almost any situation in a unique way. And whenever your feeling bored of the typical game play, you can enable some mutators, try for some big quests, or download and try out chunk packs in the workshop. Or you can make your own chunks and chunk packs, and you can play some campains made by other people. It has endless fun, and even though it says I only have 55 hours, trust me when I say I have countless hours on other gaming platforms.

author: {'steamid': '76561198829884832', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2459, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1712490338}
review:
治安の終わった街で市長の座を奪うべく殺したり強奪したり脅迫したり隠密したりしながらミッションを達成し、次のステージへと進んでいく
自由度が非常に高く、出来そうなことは大体出来るため、ミッション達成のための道筋を考えている間は非常に楽しい
犯罪行為が人に見つかると、見つかった相手と友好関係にある奴らと一斉に敵対し、流れ弾に当たった奴らも乱闘し始める地獄絵図が見られる
プレイアブルキャラが多く、固有能力とフロア毎に達成すべき固有のミッションがあるため、何週でも新鮮な気持ちでプレイできる良作

author: {'steamid': '76561198055850911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 179, 'playtime_at_review': 1387, 'last_played': 1711982243}
review:
Chaotic fun. When things go wrong it's often just as entertaining as when things goes perfectly. You can sink a LOT of time in this game unaware of any time passing by.
To start off you  pick a character with unique stats and gimmicks. Each one with a unique objective that all feed into the sandbox npc mayhem simulator. Nearly every character gives you a different playstyle that keeps this game fresh every time you play.
This game is an EASY RECOMMEND
A few characters are locked behind a dlc paywall but that's fine for the value the game comes pre-packaged with. Plenty of unlockable characters. And COOP.
It's good
Buy it
Thanks for reading!

author: {'steamid': '76561198360434929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 14, 'playtime_at_review': 1780, 'last_played': 1711586138}
review:
Platinum Review:

Streets of rogue is a brilliant game of mayhem and skill. By picking one of the game's many characters, you have a unique set of traits and a main quest that determine your playstyle for that run. One of my biggest complaints with roguelike games is it gets repetitive fast. Fortunately, the vastly different roles, from the button mashing Monke to the cunning hacker or sneaky assassin, all lend themselves to a unique experience with each run. The multiplayer adds wonderful spice as well. Having multiple people is a boon, but managing everyone's quests and trying to keep everybody alive adds complexity. The intuitive combination of objects allowing you to solve problems in unique ways is wonderful. For example, the first time I beat the game I did so as the Gorilla. The mayor was surrounded by guards and I couldn't reach him, then he went to the spa and an electroshock pill that ended up in the water supply caused chaos that let me seize control. I can't wait to see what Streets of Rogue 2 has in store for us.

I think this is a great game and worth its price tag!

author: {'steamid': '76561199158168340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1643, 'last_played': 1710094577}
review:
O jogo é divertido, tem um fator de replay bom, da pra jogar co-op o que facilita e deixa muito mais divertido.
Tem uma grande variedade de boneco, com cada um fazendo algo que pode ser um fator decisivo, com o co-op isso se torna uma piscina de mixing das forças e fraquezas de cada boneco.
Dá para fazer bonecos personalizados o que deixa ainda mais legal.
as fases são ótimas, sempre randoms e com uma variedade viva dentro dela mesma.

Recomendo pegar para jogar solo u com amigos

review:
It looks like such a simple game (and it is very easy to just jump in and play / cause mayhem). But there's a surprising amount of detail and weird complexity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198806078627', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 177, 'playtime_at_review': 1556, 'last_played': 1711403525}
review:
Street of Rogue what can i say about this game 

Pros 
you can do whatever you want 
Fun game to try it out you can play it forever Forever until you get bored 
You have chars to pick and they all have different roles and they own mission depending of what you pick zombies , soldier , gangster etc etc a lot more to discover 

You don't need to beat the game by killing everyone , give them drinks , pollute the air and take them by surprise , become a ninja , create your own char and your own traits and item 
And a lot more.
its a 10/10 totally worth it if you enjoy 2D rogue like RPG

Now about the bad stuff about this game and i'm sad to say it that ....... 

There is NONE 
Just buy the game and enjoy

author: {'steamid': '76561198071092084', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 8040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8040, 'last_played': 1694044175}
review: Extremely fun to play with friends, hectic gameplay will ensue. Both killing everyone and stealth/pacifist are rewarded and viable. playing different classes leads to very different gameplay, all good. also, working with the classes' strengths in weaknesses is interesting and allows you to be clever and skillful. Making your own classes is very fun, and your able to make yourself wildly over powered, even while staying within the point limit. I made a class that has extremely high fist damage with zombiism and vampirism, which gives you a way to heal and an army of undead friendlies. So, many friendlies that I would just punch them through walls to access objectives and so they would attack people inside. Overall, a solid roguelite, that is super good in co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275176757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1557270712}
review: Fun little rouge-lite game that doesn't take itself too seriously. Unlike a lot of rougelike games that are difficult and can be infuriating, Streets of Rouge is a lighthearted take on the genre that's fun and humorous to play. So many uniquely fun and hilarious mechanics mixed with the fast-paced game-play and bomb af music makes it quite an enjoyable game to use as a pick-me-up, rather that be for a few minutes or a few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561199239471767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 46, 'playtime_at_review': 1820, 'last_played': 1711634523}
review: Короче смысл игры свергнуть президента и встать на его место, ну типа революция , но весь прикол сюжета в том ,что после каждого свержения президента людям снова что то не нравится и мы опять свергаем нового президента ( и этот круг идёт до бесконечности (типо любое общество приводит к революции)).  В игре есть 6 этажей , цель - добраться до 6 этажа  и каким то образом стать президентом . Для того что бы пробраться на следующий этаж ,нужно сначала выполнить задание на этом и в этих заданиях не всегда нужно убивать ,как это принято в рогаликах . Весь прикол игры в том что ты можешь максимально по разному (в зависимости от твоего персонажа и твоих хотелок) выполнять эти задания . Вот например задание - ограбить сундук в охраняемом доме ты можешь :просто перебить всех в доме и забрать сундук, пройти по стелсу никого не убивая , подкупить бомжа что бы он сделал всё задание за тебя , подкупить охрану что бы она ушла , угрожать охране что бы она ушла , отравить воздух в вентиляции тем самым убить всех врагов и это даже не половина всех способов выполнения задания ,но всё это зависит от персонажей из за которых геймплей и игра в корни меняется ,например есть персонаж хакер - пиздец слабый чел и он просто не сможет убить всю охрану сам ,в таком случае он берёт взламывает систему безопасности в доме ,что бы она хуячила своих же охраников . Или вот персонаж комик -  очень слабый ,но благодаря своим шуткам может собрать армию фанатов которая просто пройдёт всё за него .И тоже  самое с концовкой игры , что бы стать президентом не обязательно убивать старого ,можно например просто победить на выборах , вежливо попросить президента отдать власть и т.д. И ещё дохрена всего .Супер крута советую всем :steamhappy

author: {'steamid': '76561198074482804', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 19715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19715, 'last_played': 1710036595}
review:
An immersive sim that is not immersive, or even anything like any immersive sim. I mainly make the comparison because the options the player is given to complete whatever objectives they have is so open in the same way that an Immersive Sim game is. I mean the description of the game name drops Deus Ex I think this Im-sim approach is very intentional.
This kind of freedom this game gives you, in a somewhat randomized rogue-like environment. It makes for probably the most replayable game in my steam library, that's pretty high praise and replayability is something I really look for in a game.

I just love the options to approach each problem in this game. Quite literally dozens of ways to complete each quest depending on your gear, your perks, your character and their ability, who you can hire in the area to help you, things in the environment you can interact with like air vents and computers, vending machines that let you buy new items that create new options for you. It really is endless and completely based on how that floor happens to be generated. I really think this game is my favourite rogue-like: So much randomization, constant choices for the player to make that will significantly impact their run, always rewarding the player, (level ups, chicken nuggets, money, quest reward items) a myriad of playable characters with unique "big quests" to complete, several options aka mutators to adjust difficulty to enjoy the game however the player wants. 

Pro-tip for the combat, switching weapons slows down time so you basically have bullet-time in this game whenever you want, I was originally going to say the combat in this game is a bit too simple but you can actually use this to dodge bullets and get around enemies and it's really fun, the combat in this game is overall just more item based, you can use your skill to kill a melee enemy but if you are out-gunned then you are just out-gunned.

My only real complaints is that there aren't more mutators and more achievements. I 100% this game on achievements like 100 hours ago and I didn't even complete all the big quests for the whole roster of characters. Please Matt, add an achievement for "completed every big quest in the game" and another for "completed all DLC character's big quests" I know you are working hard on SoR2 and I'm really looking forward to it but PLEASE, I need to earn more achievements, I need to prove my love of this game to the whole of the steam community.

author: {'steamid': '76561198803024659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 3643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 33, 'playtime_at_review': 3317, 'last_played': 1712251899}
review:
что ж, игра хороша.

ее мне дарила бывшая девушка, но поиграть на тот момент времени не было, однако в этом году хорошо так подсел на простой, рипетативный и не требующий особых навыков геймплей. 

подкупает большим количеством персонажей с уникальными способностями, и так оно и есть, да только откровенно говоря (по своему и не только опыту) вне зависимости от того, на ком вы играете, все скатывается в лютое мочилово (или детский садик "Солнышко" если играете за комика, да еще и с суперспособностью).

с удовольствием прошел на все достижения, веселый и простенький челлендж.

советую ли я эту игру как нечто хардкорное/супер нелинейное? - нет
как крутую казуальную песочницу с необычной концепцией (мини города со своей инфраструктурой и жизнью)? - однозначно, но по скидке за 200+- рублей (обязательно с дополнениями)

жду вторую часть, уверен что буду в восторге.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022299454', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 7891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7563, 'last_played': 1710296401}
review:
Streets of Rogue is an incredibly hard game. I would even go as far as to call it unfair at times.
The learning curve is so high that even after 100 hours I would still say I kind of suck at this, and almost every new mechanic I discover results in the loss of a run.

When a run can be 3 hours, the game being very hard can be incredibly frustrating. The meta progression system can actually be harmful at times, and you need to edit your unlocks from time to time to make sure you're not clogging the run down with worthless stuff for your run and making things even harder.

All that said, there's nothing quite as satisfying as completing a run through careful preparation, skilled gameplay, and a bit of luck. If you're the type of player who enjoys this kind of process, Streets of Rogue is an amazing experience that'll keep you coming back, possibly for years.

If you're easily discouraged, mutators can make the game a lot easier, and they're not difficult to get. You can tailor each run to your own experience, and have a lot of fun doing so.

The game is heavily replayable, and I recommend it to pretty much everyone who has some free time on their hands.

review:
有意思的游戏，这里说下我对部分角色的看法
狼人：高爆发，变身后狂右键秒天秒地 但是注意别冲到别人子弹或者陷阱把自己冲死
点名npc前缀mod，一般远程对枪或者嗑巨人力量然后稳定系统上去冲[spoiler] 否则就是被缩小秒杀😡 [/spoiler]
店主：高火枪，钱多得用不完，复制攒药拿子弹无脑突突突
黑客：玩着懵比，果然这种动脑子的角色不适合我
奴隶主：还行，挺有意思的 可以随身携带会打架的炸弹（
炸弹人：炸弹可以用来炸墙炸人逃跑，做任务方便但是面对诸如杀手机器人等高血量个体略显乏力
吸血鬼：吸血前期强，后期有点强，好好打应该不太会似
食人者：随身携带喷火枪烧烤尸体，食人前期还行，后期是很不错的回血手段
匪徒：前期处处受掣肘，后面比店主还有钱，拉着一大帮人枪战
机器人：强度高，上限低
贫民：后期四维满，技能多 前期缺钱
游戏mod很少 原价贵了但是打折还是可以入手玩玩的

author: {'steamid': '76561198209376420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 9881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 17, 'playtime_at_review': 9862, 'last_played': 1711330841}
review:
I was in Industrial 3 and the killer robot was after me. I got caught stealing from a bar and two retards decided to fight me. I got killed by an explosion from the generator nearby, as it was a small room. I resurrected as I had used a resurrection shampoo on an earlier floor, but a second or two later, I was hit and killed by a rocket from the killer robot's rocket launcher.

I hate the killer robot so much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198820176125', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3342, 'last_played': 1708344299}
review:
It's a game. A game where you take over a city however you like. Pick one of various different classes, swing/fight/sneak/talk your way to the mayor and replace him, either by force or by peaceful means. With all these various ways to win the game, you'll find yourself playing this game over and over (in a good way).

There's also mutators and traits you can toggle on and off, either making the game less luck-based or more challenging. There's also super special abilities, serving as rewards for getting good at playing said classes.

author: {'steamid': '76561199438297421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5013, 'last_played': 1707264661}
review: Jogar esse jogo é uma experiência que eu não posso descrever com palavras!! Tem tantos personagens, tantas formas de jogar e tantas possibilidades de níveis que sua experiência é quase ilimitada. Jogar com amigos torna a experiência mais louca e divertida o possível, muitas vezes eu ria tanto que minha barriga doía kkkkkk. Eu recomendo 100% esse jogo caso você goste do gênero Rogue-Like ou simplismente goste de um jogo mais "recriativo" e frenético. Além disso, as músicas desse jogo são ótimas e reforçam a atmosfera caótica dos níveis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081587293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 278, 'playtime_at_review': 4519, 'last_played': 1711810701}
review:
こんな楽しいゲームを知らなかったなんて！
相手の死体は殴れば爆散し、銃にハンマー、ロケットにゴリラ、放火に爆破に幽霊にゾンビに吸血鬼！

カスみたいなゲームだぜ！と始めは思ったがシンプルなシステムにも関わらず奥の深い戦略性に脱帽。
相手を殺さず、見つからずにクリアすれば経験値に大きなボーナスが貰えるので殺す理由が案外小さく、暗殺ミッションでさえ平和的に街から立ち去ってもらう事で解決出来るので今ある持ち物を駆使してどうやって事態を「解決」するかに頭を使う事になる。勿論全部ロケットランチャーで解決してもいい。
さらにキャラクターごとの特性が非常に大きく、単純で毎回似たような地形にも関わらず操作キャラクターによって全く違って見える事さえある。
最終目標である市長からの帽子（＝市長の地位）の奪取も、暴力で奪い取ってもいいし、（怪しい機械で）仲良くなって平和的に受け取っても良い。これまでのステージで人々からの印象が良ければ選挙で勝負も出来るし、市長の失言を放送しキレた市民との大乱闘から漁夫の利を得ても良い。

バーテンダーは青酸カリだろうが煙草だろうが怪しい注射器だろうがカクテルにし、敵対状態でない相手に飲ませる事が出来る。毒殺し放題な上に基本的にみんなが友好的になってくれるので選挙で勝つのが一番楽なキャラクターでもある。勿論選挙をロケットランチャーで代える事も出来る。

ハッカーは相手を守る筈の電子機器を遠隔で乗っ取る事が出来るので他のキャラクターでは突入に躊躇する大施設はただの豆腐。ロケットランチャーで壁ごと吹き飛ばす選択肢も残っている。

吸血鬼はそこら辺の人の血を吸って回復出来るのでパワープレイに向くと見せかけ、対立する人狼が強力なので暴力一辺倒では難しい。勿論全部ロケットランチャーで解決出来るが。

兵士は強いし銃持ってるし殺人で無から銃弾が補充されるアイテムを持っているのでアホみたいに強い……と思わせてそれに慣れると後半の敵（警察。特級警官はヤバい。）が強く多いステージで苦労する。ロケットランチャーがあると良い。

暗殺者はステルス状態になれるが人とすれ違うと解除される欠点もあり（アップグレードで解決）ビッグクエストでの暗殺対象が群れている事もあり油断がならない。ロケットランチャーで吹き飛ばすと楽。

警察は非戦闘状態の相手を逮捕できるので、他のキャラよりもステルスミッションになる傾向がある。
犯罪者を逮捕してキャリアを積む事が目標だが、犯罪者はいないならいないでわざと脱獄させたり、犯罪者の逮捕にわざと失敗し犯罪者の攻撃に民間人を巻き込んでそれに反撃した民間人（暴行罪！）を逮捕したりで作ったり増やしたり出来る。信じがたい事にロケットランチャーでは逮捕出来ない！
他のキャラクターも癖が強い連中だらけで初期アイテムの重要性（安価に購入可能な自販機がある。）も高いので同じミッションであってもキャラクターが違えば全く違う方法でクリアする事になる。キャラクター固有のビッグクエストの達成も目指すと更にだ！

ステージ構成も、最初のスラムは警察無し→警察有り→（最終3ステージ目なので）特殊イベント有りと段階的にゲームに慣れさせてくれる優しい仕様。
次の工業地帯はスラムの単純な上位であり人も警察も罠も多い。さらに次の公園は雰囲気が一変し凶悪な人食いが出現する他外から丸見えのガラス壁が初登場。
そして銃火器が蔓延する歓楽街を経て、次なる上級市民たちが住む住宅地は仕掛けを突破するための薬物と回復アイテムである酒の入手が非常に困難と事前準備を試してくる。

最初の最初は単純で暴力的なゲームだと思ったけど、やればやるほど緻密な戦略性（ロケットランチャーである程度代替可能）や事前準備、ゲームシステムへの理解と建物の構造（全ての物体にはなんらかの使い道がある！）を利用する事の重要性が明らかになる。
勿論初期からの調整を重ねた結果だろうけれど、ここまで丁寧にバランスを調整されたゲームは案外無い。ここ5年ぐらいで最大のお気に入りになりつつある。良いぞこれは！凄い良いぞ！

review: I've played this game for years on friends computers and I just picked it up myself to help support the devs (can't wait for the sequel!). It is fun as hell. Its practically pixel GTA. I really enjoy characters like the Doctor and Cop, there is a certain kind of thrill trying to take down folks as stealthfully as possible without killing them. Then again, sometimes its just fun to let loose and kill em all! I cannot recommend this game enough.

review:
It is a good because it is an fun arcade game in an openworld with many random fun quest. Also the pixel art is good and you can custom you hero and use editor to make your own maps . You can also download workshop map and characters.
It miss only the possibilty to change or replace the sprite and tiles of the game by your own. You can only change for character some physical aspect but limited.
IT will be good also to add for a next game car, fly and boat wich can be also customize or pixel change by the player.

Из минусов быстро проходится и как будто нечего делать становится, но в целом реиграбельная.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215610776', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 197, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1712309532}
review:
游戏是老游戏了，但是机制却很新或者说很独特。不同于其他rouge，除了功能性npc以外都是怪，这个游戏里有很多中立npc，不同npc还区分阵营，就像很多rpg里一样。因此通关方式也不是说抵达下一个出口就算完成，而是要完成某些任务才可以离开。不同角色之间有足够大的机制上的差异，直接影响游戏的通关方式。这一点在rouge上是很可贵的，大部分的rouge不同角色基本上是换把武器biubiubiu或者砍砍砍。这方面它就像rpg一样提供了和平通关、潜行通关之类的玩法。
缺点也不是没有，随机生成的地图，房间库和任务库十分浅，玩了两个小时就觉得有重复了，而且地图有一些莫名其妙的地块，看上去像是生成错误一样。
可惜我对于rouge比较兴致缺缺，一开始是奔着有点像rpg来的，新鲜感过后还是觉得比较一般。这个游戏比较着重于角色的机制和游戏的机制相结合，反而rouge的部分不太有趣。像杀手系列，做成关卡制，精心设计若干个大地图和固定任务，那样我会比较愿意玩下去

author: {'steamid': '76561197992552621', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3227, 'last_played': 1708819216}
review:
Streets of Rogue is a Roguelike Sandbox city simulation split up into multiple levels. You play a member of the resistance tasked with overthrowing the corrupt Mayor of the city. At the beginning of a run you pick your class which dictates your starting items as well as a unique optional big quest to complete. 

On each level you are given random tasks that you must complete to advance. Every third level also has a level wide event to shake things up. There are 5 groupings of these levels that make up the different biomes of the game with Mayor city being the final level. 

The selection of different classes and procedural generation gives the game a high replayability. On top of that the characters have different behaviors in relation to each other, such as thieves trying to steal from people, gang members fighting with the opposite gang on sight, and cops getting violent with just about everybody. Each task can be solved in multiple ways and additional items can be unlocked with chicken nuggets that you get for free when you level up. Also on level up you can choose from one of three random perks with additional perks able to be unlocked. 

I found Streets of Rogue to be difficult but satisfying. There is a lot to learn and sometimes you can just sit back and watch the city operate without getting involved. Playing as the different classes switches things up significantly enough that no two runs every really feel the same. Its a fun game that can be played at your own pace.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986055450', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1517, 'last_played': 1706724675}
review:
AWESOME GAME! From the moment I dove into its anarchic world, I found myself hooked on its easy-to-learn yet endlessly entertaining gameplay. The game's missions offer a refreshing variety of approaches, thanks to the plethora of intriguing characters at your disposal. Whether you're a stealthy hacker or a brute-force brawler, there's a playstyle tailored just for you. Plus, the option for co-op with up to four players adds an extra layer of chaotic fun!

One of the standout features of "Streets of Rogue" is its delightful humor, which infuses every aspect of the game with a lighthearted charm. From quirky character interactions to unexpected events, there's never a dull moment in this anarchic city. 

/Must-play for all fans of rogue-lite genre!/

review: God I fucking love this game, it's the first game I ever 100%'ed and I'm not even done playing it. There's such a wide variety of characters and (mostly) all of them are super fun to play. Personally, I love playing Vampire, Doctor, Courier (DLC) and Hacker. If you're at all a fan of roguelikes, or just quality games, go buy Streets of Rogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393356073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 84080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 570, 'playtime_at_review': 79507, 'last_played': 1712403448}
review:
J'ai passé 1325 heures de jeu au moment où j'écris ce commentaire. Je passerai sûrement encore plusieurs heures dessus. En plus d'être un jeu bien complet et délirant, il est possible de personnaliser ses parties pour rendre plus facile ou beaucoup plus compliqué le chemin qui mène au poste de la mairie.
Je me suis tapé des fous-rires dès les premières heures de jeu, et je rigole encore de différentes manières en fonction des mutateurs que j'active en début de partie. Le jeu terminé à 100%, les défis quotidiens sont un bon moyen de passer encore des heures et des heures sur le jeu. Chaque parties sont quasi uniques, avec un large choix de personnage à jouer, voir à customiser.
Fan de jeux vidéos depuis mon enfance, ayant grandit avec SEGA et Nintendo, Street of Rogue est vraiment une pépite à ne pas manquer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169750906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1700029224}
review:
[b]Got bored.[/b]

I get the appeal. Silly, creative gauntlet of challenges with RNG "every run is different" thing. Ideal fodder for pop culture and video streamers that look at Top 10 Lists and say "too hard."

Me? I reached "lost interest," then went several extra hours hoping it would click. It did not. But if it soothes the anuses of the fanboys, I [i]am[/i] a bitter misanthrope that eagerly awaits the day he can yell at the neighborhood kids for playing too close to his property.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970938346', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 558, 'playtime_forever': 1223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1223, 'last_played': 1704324846}
review:
[h2]Tight mechanics; Robust build/playstyle options; Gets stale fast[/h2]

Not worth the full asking price by a long shot. For what you get I'm feeling like this should be priced under $7 regularly. That is just my personal opinion.

It's fun, you get a cool little world and there's lots of "interactions" between various things. Everything, even NPCs have their behavioral/event scripts, and it makes the world come alive and opens up creative gameplay approaches.

For example, you can shoot a generator through a window, which might alert guards. But as the guard is charging out of the building to get you, you bait it into shooting at you and hitting a crowd behind you, which starts a huge brawl. You can then use the distraction to finish everybody off and loot them, or sneak into the building to finish whatever brought you there in the first place (breaking into a safe, retrieving something, assassinating a key enemy, etc).

There are different player classes you can unlock and play, and they really do change the way you approach the game and strategize. There are many situations and building configurations that would be approached totally differently depending on your class. For example the hacker: a much weaker fighter but can hack terminals through walls and turn off a building's security features, or set the turrets to attack everybody. Or you can be a burglar with window-cutting tools, and you'll find that all the other burglars in the maps are your friends and will fight along side you for cheap, or sell you thief tools.

You can be a "good guy" as well and avoid conflict, free prisoners and caged-animals which then join your posse to fight with you. If you build your character in a certain direction, you can keep followers from map-to-map and increase the amount that will fight with you. Point is, there are many ways to approach the game and it's totally up to the player which is so wonderful.

All in all a very fun game. Even though I have many hours in the game, really it started to fall flat around the 3rd or 4th hour of play. The game mechanics are great, the variety of semi-randomized builds you make are dynamic and robust. Love the classes. Love that the player gets to decide how to approach the game. Yet somehow I feel I figured it all out very quickly, and as much as I kept playing to unlock different things I couldn't make it [i]click[/i]. I hoped that playing more would unlock more depth but it kinda didn't? Once you figure out the world mechanics and how everything interacts, that's it. And that really doesn't take the player very long.

I think the average player will get a 2 to 3 hours of fun before they get bored. Some players will want to unlock everything and that's fine too but expect A LOT of repetition of basic gameplay. Yes the classes are great and change the way you play, but 95% of most gameplay is the same repetitive stuff regardless.

I say buy it, but hold it on your Wishlist forever and wait for that next 80% off sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198881035936', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1701377966}
review: Smooth gameplay, colorful but not blinding graphics. The game is awesome with balancing your abilities and your faults (ex. Gorilla with punching strength and making an army, but needs a translator for shops bc can't speak English and can't hold guns). Map types are consistent, but objectives and building placement is random so it keeps a good sense of newness and discovery. Easy online multiplayer settings, not a hassle to navigate anything in any menu. Buttons are straightforward, objectives are too, but does great with being a challenge and rewarding. It's super sarcastic and funny too. You can become giant and break buildings or some random killer robot you've gotta run from or wildfires or meteors or something. Anyway, full of content, full of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198359615931', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22620, 'last_played': 1701805516}
review:
[h2]我心目中最好的肉鸽游戏：）[/h2]
第一次接触这款游戏还是在疫情的时候，当时封在家里上网课准备高考，在网上了解到了这个游戏但当时还不知道有steam这个平台，于是乎就去找资源结果只是一个测试版，每次打到第三关的时候进电梯都会自杀，当时还一直很疑惑到底是怎么回事（笑，后面有了新的电脑接触了steam之后补票的第一个游戏就是地痞街区，真的非常非常喜欢玩，试着用各种不同的职业去完成任务通关，也试着用不同的方式把任务搞定去通关（护送？我把需要护送的人做掉不就没有这个任务了bushi）也许是因为没怎么接触过单机游戏时候的滤镜的原因吧，不管何时打开地痞街区都会感觉到十分的快乐。
下面说说游戏本身的内容吧。
职业很多，而且不同的职业特点非常明显，也很有特色与此同时每个职业也有属于自己的专属任务，在完成专属任务之后可以进一步彰显不同的职业的特色，每个职业的初始道具也不同，也可以自定义角色。总的来说，如果把游戏的目的不定为通关的话，每个职业都值得尝试一下，会有不同的乐趣。当然我个人认为如果是刚接触游戏的话想要通关比较轻松的角色应该是黑客？黑客的技能运用合理的话在很多任务上还是蛮imba的~
地图设计也是很棒的，地图中的可破坏部分很多，不同地区的地图特点也是比较明显的，也有着很多的可互动元素，也正是有这么多的互动元素才使得完成任务的方式更加多样。
就先写到这里吧，第一次写评测，等什么时候想起来新的内容再来写一点

author: {'steamid': '76561198104358473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 6058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4196, 'last_played': 1709730973}
review:
Basic functions of the game fail to function at random. You can do everything right and still fail because the game decided you would fail. The save function, by which you can leave the game mid run and come back later, sometimes just deletes your save for no reason. The autotargeting is the worst I've ever seen, will frequently have you firing shots dozens of degrees removed from the angle you told it to fire to shoot at targets nowhere near your cursor that aren't even remotely a threat instead of the very obvious threat two millimetres from it. Rabid chimpanzees could code a more functional game.

I'd like to say this is the worst game ever finished, but that unfortunately isn't true. That dubious honor goes to Our Darker Purpose.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990913342', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1704398360}
review:
I'll be reviewing Streets of Rogue as the stone-faced grouch that I am, beating it repeatedly solo. SoR follows the traditional rule of co-op games in that it's well made for antics with friends, especially given the chaotic nature of SoR and the synergies created by the class system.

SoR is a rogue-like top-down view action-RPG and "immersive sim with elements of Deus Ex and Grand Theft Auto." To SoRs credit it actually does a few of those things, playing like a modern homage to the older 2D GTA titles. It's a fun sandbox merged with rogue-like levels that offer multiple approaches, limited by the variety in quest design yet doing enough to grease the rogue-like problem solving gland. There's still a lot of combat, much of it unavoidable, though you can play against that.

It does immerse you nicely, though the story is total nonsense that never takes itself seriously, thankfully vanishing after the tutorial and letting the environment and soundtrack carry things. The humor works well with the variety of goofy approaches and possible situations, mostly in the class, item and level design. I'm more amused by the idea of a Gorilla or Zombie playthrough backed by wacky utility gadgets and high explosives than I am the discount weak chuckle of "we use petrified chicken nuggets as currency!" Again, it doesn't lay it on that thick after the tutorial. 

It's a shame there aren't more set characters and quests in the game, as GTA covers for a lot of repetitive mission design by making the stories surrounding them extra entertaining. SoR does this with the final level and it's more interesting then the rest, naturally. The shallow quest pool could've been smoothed over a lot with character or area specific(maybe on the X-2 levels) set pieces/quest chains with a few more involved steps and non-generic NPCs. This also gives design space to make quests that guarantee certain approaches(i.e. stealth, talking, etc) have more chances to shine, as most quests are biased towards murder. The character-specific Big Quests are an entertaining extra but mostly a starting point or bonus and the gap in level design is felt.

So for gameplay naturally you can punch and shoot your way through, a few characters getting unique abilities with some limit to use as well as consumable items that offer strong utility. If you want to be a gungho killman then by all means, or focus on ranged combat, trap setting, or some other branch of modernish magic like hacking or bartending. There's also a limited bit of talkomancy such as making it easier to complete the item swap quests, recruit/befriend people or skirt social norms. The game mostly plays smoothly, movement and targeting as well as environment interaction being intuitive. This goes hand in hand with the default state of most levels being peaceful yet tense, a living city where every entity isn't a hostile monster. Yet. Gives you time to explore and plot your actions.

The best part of the game is the multiple ways to try to approach a tough quest or emergent problem like getting spotted by cops mid-crime or having to access a single person in a crowded shop. The quests do get repetitive, a majority of them being dives into a trap-filled box with multiple rooms and 1-4 forced combat goons, so it's impressive that things stay so interesting due to the sheer number of options or the addictive desire to pull off a run with your favorite approach. This perfectly captures the feel of a game like NetHack, where traditional builds are fun but trying to force a win out of Tourist can be infinitely engaging. The difficulty rises steadily, mostly tough yet fair and like all good rogue-likes open to the great fun of breaking the game once your head is full of overly specific knowledge.

I've used a lot of "mostly"s in this review and here's why: as much as I like SoR I found the greatest flaw to be the combat. The melee combat is atrocious. It's not unusable or unplayable. It's just not a great system and you endure it to enjoy everything else. Enemies are far, far too jittery and randomly inclined to slash rapidly at you with split second reactions and no wind up. It's possible to be hit 2+ times in under a second if you botch something adjacent to anyone with a melee weapon. Gunplay is more fair, demanding sensible use of cover, but I'd seethe every time I got ping-ponged around in melee or lost 50+ health failing little jousting approaches. How it works is that the best option is to alpha strike the enemy, using assassin characters(... like assassin, vampire, etc) or fast melee that can get backstabber and avoid line of sight/hostility toggles. If combat never starts it never hurts. Sure, it's fun if you get followers going or incite characters to fight each other, set traps, use guns or abilities at range. You're just usually in a steady decline if you get into a lot of melees or a few bad ones without a cheesy source of healing. 

Sometimes the RNG is ridiculous and you die rapidly with little input, or you enter X-3 and get "hey, screw your build" disasters or loads of unavoidable damage. It's part of the rogue-like spice but getting Police Lockdown 4 out of 5 Downtowns really killed my mood. While I want to praise the visual design for having traps that actually get me they suffer from the same problem as the melee of instant hits, especially manhole covers. There's also a few class balance issues, though perhaps I just didn't gel with them all. Well OK, Werewolf having all 1s for stats and a heinous downside to less than perfect play is a real masochist choice vs a perfectly oiled stealth machine like Vampire.

To give SoR some more praise I applaud the quality of life touches everywhere. The objectives teleporter, slowdown on item use/swap, mutator system and leniency in achievement unlocking makes the dev a real lad. I definitely want to use my Big Quest rewards all game after the effort to get them! With a good mind at the helm SoR ended up a pretty good game. For $4 on sale I'm delighted, SoR being a perfect $5 game. It's a good $10-15 game and... sorry, Overwhelmingly Positive reviews, $20 is a stretch. Definitely a fair price for a polished sequel, as SoR2 looks pretty good and I'm sure Matt has learned a great deal since SoR1 released. Here's hoping for a melee overhaul!

review:
見下ろしのミッションクリア型ローグライクゲーム。日本語化可能
多種多様な職業で与えられたミッションをクリアしていく
ステルス、暗殺、ハッキング、撃ち合い、アイテム駆使、魅了、金で解決等、同じミッションでも職業によって攻略のやり方は様々
ソロでやるならどれも慎重にやらないとクリア出来ない難易度
アイテムも回復薬も金もカツカツでなんとかクリアしたときの達成感は最高

author: {'steamid': '76561198310982836', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3942, 'last_played': 1683168812}
review:
特定の人物の排除を達成するために正面から殴りこんでもいい
誰かを雇って突撃させてもいいし、セキュリティシステムをハッキングして事故を起こしてもいい
通気口から薬品を流しこんでもいい、注意をひいて背後から暗殺してもいい
直接退去の交渉をしてもいい、建物の外から壁ごと爆破してもいい

巨大化したゴリラが突っ込んでくるかもしれないし、ゾンビの群れに巻き込まれるかもしれない
爆弾を頭につけた集団が押し入ってくるかもしれないし、隣の人が突然おかしくなって戦闘がおこるかもしれない

そんなゲームです、たのしい
プレイするキャラクターによってゲーム性が変わってくるので長く楽しめる

- I killed a person and hlad destroyed a building by hacking a fridge!
- I raised an army of zombie wich wiped out a city!

author: {'steamid': '76561198122976959', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3283, 'last_played': 1700771487}
review:
One of the most re-playable roguelites out there.

Each floor is a small town with shops, bars, police stations etc... and you need to complete a few tasks each floor to advance. There's wide variety of different characters, all with completely unique traits and very different play styles, plus a large variety of different items (hack security systems, warp through walls, poison  air supply etc, etc), so there's a near infinite number of different way to complete any task. You can even cause conflict between npc, which is always fun.

Special events at the third floor of each area really mix up the runs to prevent you getting too comfortable as well.

If the concept of an immersive sim inspired roguelite sounds at all interesting, can't go wrong with this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201177774', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1703401061}
review:
Video review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mb2AcZo8jPg&ab_channel=RainyNights

Streets of Rogue (SoR) is a genuinely flawless co-op friendly roguelite game that deserves your support. Disclaimer: I am friends with Matt Dabrowski but I promise you that does not sway my opinion whatsoever, I just think the game is honestly amazing.

You will play as one of many classes, all of which revolve around a profession or hobby or lifestyle, and begin in the Slums with little to nothing. You will work your way up through society until you eventually reach Mayor Village, where your objective is to usurp power from him via hostility or through election. You will have various ways of completing assigned tasks before you can progress to the next floor, and you can choose how passive or aggressive you wish to be. You must survive lowly pickpockets to Blaed & Crepe gang members, the mob, and supercops.

Streets of Rogue is so much fun because of the surprising amount of choice you have over how things go. You can make the game as easy or hard for yourself depending on play styles, decisions, and routes. It's also a great game to play with a friend and like most roguelites will be significantly more doable with a partner since you can revive each other instead of just instant permadeath. The art style isn't really my thing but the combat and mechanics make up for that and it does have a nice color palette with plenty of varying locations and map designs.

The classes are all distinguished from each other and play extremely differently. The fact the game has so many endings adds to the already great replay ability. There is a huge selection of items and tools to keep things interesting. The game also features intelligent NPCs with factions that have various degrees of reputation and status with each other, making things more advanced than necessary which is a good thing.

SoR is personally my favorite roguelite I've played, but I'm not super big on this genre so feel free to point me to some others if you think they are better. I look forward to playing the sequel to this gem!

10/10.

review: 玩起来就像是不能开车的gta，并且还支持4人联机，角色的选择也是多种多样，有忍者、吸血鬼之类的潜行暗杀流；还有士兵、大猩猩类的无双流；有两大帮派的人海（其实最多可能就4个随从）流；以及一些像是医生类的特殊玩法的角色，自由度很高，DLC可买可不买，也就是增加一些新角色，新玩法，买了不一定亏，不买也不要紧。并且季节促销再买会比较值。建议是20元一下就可以尝试入手了（当然还是取决于你个人的电脑配置，经济实力等因素多方结合经过判断后再买)。

author: {'steamid': '76561198345760148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 7714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 36, 'playtime_at_review': 7677, 'last_played': 1711741826}
review:
Streets of Rogue - это увлекательная 2D-рогалик, в которой ты можешь играть за одного из 26 персонажей, выполняя различные миссии и взаимодействуя с окружающим миром. Игра поражает своей гибкостью и неожиданностью, так как каждый персонаж имеет свои уникальные способности и стиль игры. Ты можешь быть убийцей, хакером, гориллой, барменом или кем угодно еще. Ты можешь подходить к заданиям творчески, используя разные предметы, союзников, врагов и окружение. Ты можешь взламывать турели, нанимать телохранителей, съедать трупы, поджигать здания и многое другое. Игра полна юмора, хаоса и веселья.

Streets of Rogue не идеальна, конечно. Миссии могут быть повторяющимися и однообразными, а мир не сильно меняется от этажа к этажу. Игра также может быть сложной и несправедливой, особенно если ты играешь в одиночку. Но все эти недостатки не могут испортить общее впечатление от игры, которая дает тебе свободу выбора и действия. Streets of Rogue - это игра, которая никогда не говорит "нет" твоим самым безумным идеям. Это игра, которая заставляет тебя смеяться, удивляться и наслаждаться каждым моментом.

Моя оценка: 9/10

review:
Holy sh*t! What an unexpected diamond among other games.

Yes, I only played for half an hour so far, but I can already tell: This game is sh*ttons of fun!

Dialogues are funny as hell, the tutorial even. Graphics absolutely beautiful in their 8-Bit-Style. Soundtracks fits, there is a story, it's interesting, it's just fun. 

Developer seems to be really interested in people's feedback.

Will definitely buy the successor as soon as it's out and be it even to only support it!

review: 捞一位友友，名字好像带一个大写的E。12月14日晚上下课回来，我跟往常一样开了局地痞街区，不一样的是这次开了区域联机和无限子弹、近战耐久的突变。我玩的是战士，有一位陌生友友玩的是吸血鬼，这位一直跟我一起玩的吸血鬼友友找到了市长帽子，我们跟另一位友友三人一同通关了主线。结束后我跟玩吸血鬼的友友再次开了新的游戏，我换了蓝帮，他依旧玩吸血鬼。遗憾的是学校到11点30断网了，当时看到他飞出去我以为是他网卡，于是我进入了下一层等他，结果发现是我的网络问题。跟这位陌生友友配合的很愉快，可惜的是没有加到联系方式也没有记住名字，希望有机会大家还能够在联机大厅相遇。

review:
I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS GAME!!

It has funny backstories for characters and it has a fun selection of characters. Not only that, you can play this with your friends which makes the experience even better. In addition, if you are a speedrunner you can play this game with the mutators SPEEDRUN. 

In the end, I totally recommend it.

P.S. I am a bit sad that they might be able to release a number 2 :(.

author: {'steamid': '76561198252787426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6966, 'last_played': 1703437813}
review:
This game is amazing!! I love it so much!!! There are so many different ways to get things done with some solutions I find making me feel like I did something really cool. The kinds of solutions you go for are even more different and available depending on what character you are being, and what point in a run you are at. Resources are a little tight early on, so you gotta really think hard to get things done as safety (or as interestingly) as possible, with more and more opportunities for causing pure chaos opening later on. 

Some of my favorite runs where when I decided to knock every single person on each floor unconscious as the doctor, the one where I kept blowing people up with their own tvs as the hacker, and the one where my siblings and I banded together to create a zombie apocalypse.

P.S. Something I don't see brought up a lot I thought I ought to mention is that the game has options for full Twitch integration as including chat interaction with the game.

review: An okay roguelike to play with friends but outside that, it's really not worth that much, even the variety that's present isn't that fundamental as well as so many systems to play with, I think there's a lot here but many of these things are underdeveloped or outright shallow. Also the art is kind of outdated without any distinct art style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198998644895', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4180, 'last_played': 1707930707}
review:
This game is pure entertainment.

The movement is fluid, and makes sense. The game is rewarding, and with everything you do, there is a reward that can come in the form of healing, XP, or items that help you on your way. There's always something to discover about the game, and you'll never run out of things to do, whether it is to get drunk at the bartender's bar or to borrow some money at the local bank.

You think the game is too hard, or not enough challenging? Try some mutators. One that makes weapons not break, one that gives you unlimited ammo, one that gives you only money as reward for quests, and many more that will make the game unique in every run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049204810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1701723502}
review: You really quoted the dumbest part of the Kotaku review for your trailer? The quote, "It almost makes you wish Deus Ex was as imaginative with its approach to cyberpunky stealth and chaos" makes absolutely zero sense. This game is nothing like Deus Ex; Cyberpunk 2077 is like Deus Ex and it's trash in comparison. This game is fun but it's no Deus Ex as hacking and stealth sorely pale in comparison. Also, the chaos aspect of Deus Ex makes more sense than this game. If you want to compare the two, though then, sure. 5/10 -> This game is completely inferior to Deus Ex in every way, shape and form. Play the original Deus Ex and Human Revolution instead of this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198131410854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1708496021}
review:
Legitimately challenging, amazing gameplay-loop, interesting interactions, and a bunch of enjoyable playstyles.  I personally like playing the Gorilla with the mutation that makes you a glasscannon (you have low hp, enemies have low hp).
I'm rather sad that I played for 8 hours straight for my first time playing, but it really is fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123079727', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 1215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1215, 'last_played': 1700277098}
review: 个别角色技能与特性做得很有趣，道具丰富多样自由度也算很高，特殊事件也让游戏刺激了不少，是要智取还是蛮力完全取决于你，但关卡设计任务做的太普通且千篇一律，并且AI有时候会莫名敌对，比如A攻击到了B，你没有动手，却有概率会A和B同时打你？？？想通关玩的话，只要通关过一次，再次游玩套路基本一样，除非你想挑战自己，到最后你会发现完全可以只做任务顺便收集些物品就可以通关了，深度不够玩久了会枯燥无聊。

author: {'steamid': '76561198888515288', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1706, 'last_played': 1702229160}
review: This game really exceeds my expectation. There are so many ways to complete the objectives using different characters/items. The difficulty makes sense and can be customized further using mutators. Achievements are fair and don't require you to grind a lot for many of them. The gameplay is very fun, I spent 20hrs in a single weekend to play this game alone. The game endings depend on how you interact with various NPCs in each level, and is definitely more complex than what the trailer shows.

review:
Imagine a classic GTA but indoors and with classes. Your character gets items for completing missions and traits upon levelling up. It takes some time to get grasp how all of this interacts. Some items are absolute game changers on a run while they amount to very little on the next one.
If you liked a run in particular, just copy the seed and play it again with different mutators and get a completely different experience.

Game runs fine for me, sometimes I can't unlock a higher frame rate. Some minor issues with stuttering in online co-op at higher game speeds. Controls are completely customizable.
